intro: Thlaspi somkheticum, commonly known as the Kashmir wallflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas, particularly in Kashmir and northern India. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically basal, rosette-shaped, and covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Thlaspi somkheticum is adapted to cold climates and is often found in rocky or alpine environments.
